goals.description: Step-change performance marketing engine's performance, rebuild Paid Social muscle, optimize spend and reduce D in (CAC + D)
Commit at least 1/3 of global marketing spend to Brand (Demand Generating) channels, and 50% of that Brand spend to 'innovative' brand activation tactics
Re-set the velocity with which we are accelerating our Organic growth ecosystem
Build an iCLV driving customer communications (CRM) engine
Increase CCVA (conversions CVA) to $350MM

key_results.metric: % of spend in Demand Generating channels
Automate bid decisioning on programmatic channels

in_scope: Rebuild Paid Social muscle with dedicated creative production capabilities and fresh global talent
Shift to incremental measurement ecosystem
Automate bid decisioning on programmatic channels (Search, Display, PS)
Discount spend reduction through targeted/personalized discounts
Brand investment in celebrity partnerships, sponsorships, and innovative brand integrations
Accelerate SEO and GEO progress
Remove voucher attribution anchor to allow full-price conversions
Build pro-active community engagement muscle
Create local CRM comms service layer
Launch iCLV optimization function for send decisioning
GenAI applications for automated business insights, personalized customer journeys, and creative development
Transition from discount-led to product innovation and quality-led storytelling
Continuous creative testing and format innovation
deprioritized: Advanced forecasting capabilities (only incremental improvements planned)
Product monetization expansion (one-time ordering, non-subscription pathways)

dependencies: Finance, Data, and Marketing alignment for forecasting models
Third-party platforms/vendors (Haus, Iterable, CDPs)
Product and operations teams for monetization models
Consistent campaign setup and CRM tooling
Discount recommender rollout
Iterable migration
Project 5M for in-app community engagement
MMM and geo-test frameworks for brand measurement
Unified source of truth for data

risks.risk: Measurement of Brand Investments - MMMs and geo-tests do not capture long-term brand equity effects
risks.mitigation: Building new frameworks to link brand KPIs (awareness, consideration) to financial metrics (CVA, CLV); interim decisions will require conviction-based brand investments

risks.risk: Data Quality & Fragmentation - Privacy regulation, lack of unified source of truth, fragmented data-sharing reduce accuracy of DDA, mROI, and AI models
risks.mitigation: Dependencies on third-party platforms/vendors being managed; focus on improving data infrastructure

risks.risk: Operational & Tech Dependencies - Inconsistent campaign setup limiting speed to market and scalability of AI-driven personalization
risks.mitigation: Focus on standardizing CRM tooling, completing Iterable migration, and rolling out discount recommender

risks.risk: Competitive Landscape - Rivals with aggressive performance spend and diversified models threatening market share
risks.mitigation: Focus on customer centricity, innovating where product and offer differentiation meet unmet customer needs

risks.risk: Reliance on Pay-for-Play Channels - Dependence on Meta/Google poses risk as LLM-driven search/visibility shifts accelerate
risks.mitigation: Diversification via SEO optimization, partnership ads, affiliate content, and testing new platforms (Pinterest, TikTok, WhatsApp)

risks.risk: Digital Content Evolution - Rising consumer expectations and app fatigue increase pressure to deliver daily value
risks.mitigation: Scaling GenAI content generation and optimizing in-app experiences

initiatives: Shift to incremental measurement ecosystem
Automate >80% of bid decisioning on programmatic channels
Rebuild Paid Social capabilities focusing on whitelisting, video, reach, TikTok
Implement rapid, low-cost discount elasticity testing methods across all markets
Execute 4 Global A+ celebrity partnerships
Execute 4 Global sponsorship deals
Execute 4 Global 3rd party brand integration partnerships (AirBNB, Ikea, Crocs, Spotify)
Execute >4 cookware partnerships in NA (Zwilling, Misen, Caraway, Nutribullet, NINJA)
Execute 2 Factor partnerships (Oura, lululemon, Hoku)
Remove voucher attribution anchor
Accelerate SEO and GEO progress
Build pro-active community engagement muscle (digital, in-app with Project 5M, physical)
Build one team for iCLV comms
Create local CRM comms service layer
Launch and optimize send decisioning with iCLV optimization function
Expand GenAI-driven reporting pilots across all channels and geographies
Scale AI/ML for one-to-one personalization across acquisition, retention, and reactivation
Automate campaign QA, translations, reporting, landing page updates
Embed continuous creative testing and insight loops
Test one-time ordering in Q4 2025 (limited capacity)

results.doc_title: DRAFT [HelloTech Launch Announcement] - Factor Form Shopify Storefront is LIVE in the US!

goals.description: Launch Factor Form Shopify Storefront in the US
Drive targeted traffic through official marketing campaigns
Monitor performance and measure impact of dedicated store
Support 2026 growth strategy through alternative shopping experience

key_results.baseline: Not specified - current Factor meal subscriber conversion rate is higher than net-new customers

in_scope: Flexible purchasing options (one-time and subscription)
Simplified Shopify checkout with ShopPay
Intuitive customer portal for subscription and account management
Complete Form product line: Daily Greens, Hydration Boost, Whey Protein, and bundles
Marketing campaign launch (Dec 26, 2025)
Performance monitoring over 6 months
Implementing improvements for easier store management
Building 'science' landing pages for product education

dependencies: Factor Form Squad for technical implementation
Market Innovation Squad for platform development
Analytics and Data team for performance tracking
Legal team for compliance and approvals
Revenue & Marketing Accounting for financial setup
Global Payments team for payment processing
Tax Teams for tax compliance
Product and Engineering Leadership for technical infrastructure

risks.risk: Limited purchasing flexibility may be a barrier for net-new shoppers compared to Factor meal subscribers
risks.mitigation: Introduced flexible purchasing options with both one-time purchases and subscriptions on Shopify platform

risks.risk: Lower conversion rate for net-new customers versus existing Factor meal subscribers
risks.mitigation: Streamlined Shopify checkout, ShopPay integration, and intuitive customer portal to improve user experience

initiatives: Launch Factor Form Shopify Storefront at factorform.com
Implement flexible purchasing options (one-time and subscription)
Deploy streamlined Shopify checkout with ShopPay
Create intuitive customer portal for order and subscription management
Launch official marketing campaigns (Dec 26, 2025)
Conduct 6-month performance monitoring and analytics tracking
Implement no-code environment for rapid testing and launches
Develop 'science' landing pages for product education and authority building
Enable easier store management without technical support

results.doc_title: DRAFT [HelloTech Launch Announcement] - Factor Form Shopify Storefront is LIVE in the US!

goals.description: Launch Factor Form Shopify Storefront in the US
Drive targeted traffic through official marketing campaigns
Monitor performance and measure impact of dedicated store
Support 2026 growth strategy through alternative shopping experience

key_results.baseline: Not specified - current Factor meal subscriber conversion rate is higher than net-new customers

in_scope: Flexible purchasing options (one-time and subscription)
Simplified Shopify checkout with ShopPay
Intuitive customer portal for subscription and account management
Complete Form product line: Daily Greens, Hydration Boost, Whey Protein, and bundles
Marketing campaign launch (Dec 26, 2025)
Performance monitoring over 6 months
Implementing improvements for easier store management
Building 'science' landing pages for product education

dependencies: Legal team approval and compliance
Revenue & Marketing Accounting support
Global Payments infrastructure
Tax Teams coordination
Analytics and Data team for performance tracking
Product and Engineering Leadership - New Ventures Tribe
Market Innovation Squad for implementation
Factor Form Squad for technical execution

risks.risk: Limited purchasing flexibility may be a barrier for net-new shoppers compared to Factor meal subscribers
risks.mitigation: Introduced flexible purchasing options allowing both one-time purchases and subscriptions

risks.mitigation: Streamlined Shopify checkout with ShopPay and intuitive customer portal to improve user experience

risks.risk: Technical dependencies slowing down experience improvements and product launches
risks.mitigation: No-code Shopify environment enabling rapid testing and launches by internal teams

initiatives: Launch Factor Form Shopify Storefront at factorform.com
Implement flexible purchasing options (one-time and subscription)
Deploy streamlined Shopify checkout with ShopPay integration
Create intuitive customer portal for order and subscription management

Enable rapid testing and launching of experience improvements in no-code environment

goals.description: Create bottom-up quarterly plan for Consumer Mega-Alliance
Complete draft bottom-up tribe quarterly plans
Finalize bottom-up Q1 quarterly plan for review
Submit Q1 plan to leadership
Adjust quarterly plan based on Meta Backlog

key_results.target: At least 1 deliverable per squad per month
High confidence in delivering roadmap initiatives

in_scope: Bottom-up quarterly planning (new approach for Q1 2026)
Monthly deliverables by squad
Product hypothesis formulation for each initiative
Tribe-level priority stack-ranking
Capacity planning (bottom-up or top-down)
Human-understandable deliverable names (avoid jargon/acronyms)
Product specs for each initiative
Half-day planning workshop with tribe leads (Dec 4)
T-shirt sizing for engineering estimates
Compiling Q1 initiative backlog by Product Leads
Breaking down quarterly deliverables into monthly chunks
deprioritized: Detailed engineering estimation (deferred until after initial planning)
Discovery work in roadmap (should focus on deliverables)
Automatic roadmap generation (manual updates for now)

dependencies: Meta Backlog (MBL) release - not yet finalized for Q1
SMT sign-off on quarterly plan
Assaf and Brian clarification on Q1 plan definition of done
Confirmation of planning expectations (monthly deliverables vs. detailed capacity plan)
New org structure implementation
2026 Yearly Plan finalization
Domain objectives and squad KPIs
Product spec documentation (AI-Native Product Development Handbook)

risks.risk: Meta Backlog not finalized before planning deadline
risks.mitigation: Plan bottom-up first based on domain objectives and squad KPIs, then adjust when MBL is published

risks.risk: Unclear definition of done for Q1 plan (granularity, capacity coverage)
risks.mitigation: Mega-alliance leads reviewing with Assaf on Tuesday to confirm expectations

risks.risk: Potential for unnecessary work due to unclear requirements
risks.mitigation: Working to clarify questions with leadership before requesting detailed work from teams

risks.risk: Tight timeline with Dec 5 draft deadline
risks.mitigation: Starting initiative backlog compilation immediately, keeping planning lightweight and focused on outcomes

risks.risk: Quarterly deliverables in YP may not reflect best way to drive squad KPIs
risks.mitigation: Product Leads can propose changes during Q1 planning

initiatives: Consumer Mega-Alliance Q1 2026 quarterly planning
Ignite Engagement – The Hub of Our Food Ecosystem
Loyalty & Virality initiatives (Share squad, Missions, Rewards)
Consumer Acceleration roadmap
Client Platform capacity planning
The Pets Table roadmap
Good Chop roadmap
Factor Form roadmap
Shopping Foundation roadmap (Cart, Shopping Platform, Personalization)
Referrals Strategic Alignment 2026
Consumer Core tribe planning
